speaker: Lena
text: Morning, team! Let’s keep this brief and productive today. Tim, how’s the backend migration going?
ipa: ˈmɔrnɪŋ tiːm | lɛts kiːp ðɪs briːf ənd prəˈdʌktɪv təˈdeɪ | tɪm | haʊz ðə ˈbækˌɛnd ˌmaɪˈɡreɪʃən ˈɡoʊɪŋ
stress: MORNING TEAM | LET’S KEEP THIS BRIEF AND PRODUCTIVE TODAY | TIM | HOW’S THE BACKEND MIGRATION GOING
linking:
"let’s keep" → /lɛts kiːp/ (s links to k)
"brief and" → /briːf ənd/ (f links into vowel)
"how’s the" → /haʊz ðə/ (z links to article)

speaker: Tim
text: Hey! It’s going pretty smoothly. I’ve moved the most critical endpoints already. The new structure is far more efficient than the previous one.
ipa: heɪ | ɪts ˈɡoʊɪŋ ˈprɪɾi ˈsmuːðli | aɪv muːvd ðə ˈmoʊst ˈkrɪtɪkəl ˈɛndˌpɔɪnts ɔlˈrɛdi | ðə nu ˈstrʌktʃɚ ɪz fɑr mɔr ɪˈfɪʃənt ðən ðə ˈpriːviəs wʌn
stress: HEY | IT’S GOING PRETTY SMOOTHLY | I’VE MOVED THE MOST CRITICAL ENDPOINTS ALREADY | THE NEW STRUCTURE IS FAR MORE EFFICIENT THAN THE PREVIOUS ONE
linking:
"going pretty" → /ˈɡoʊɪŋ ˈprɪɾi/ (flap t)
"structure is" → /ˈstrʌktʃɚ ɪz/ (r links to vowel)

speaker: Lena
text: Nice. Is it stable enough for us to start QA testing?
ipa: naɪs | ɪz ɪt ˈsteɪbəl əˈnʌf fər ʌs tə stɑrt ˈkjuːˈeɪ ˈtɛstɪŋ
stress: NICE | IS IT STABLE ENOUGH FOR US TO START QA TESTING
linking:
"is it" → /ɪz ɪt/ (z links to i)
"for us to" → /fər ʌs tə/ (smooth prepositional flow)

speaker: Tim
text: Yes, but I’d recommend waiting a little longer. I’ll finish the database sync today — it’s taking slightly more time than expected.
ipa: jɛs | bət aɪd ˌrɛkəˈmɛnd ˈweɪtɪŋ ə ˈlɪɾl ˈlɔŋɡɚ | aɪl ˈfɪnɪʃ ðə ˈdeɪtəˌbeɪs sɪŋk təˈdeɪ | ɪts ˈteɪkɪŋ ˈslaɪtli mɔr taɪm ðən ɪkˈspɛktɪd
stress: YES | BUT I’D RECOMMEND WAITING A LITTLE LONGER | I’LL FINISH THE DATABASE SYNC TODAY | IT’S TAKING SLIGHTLY MORE TIME THAN EXPECTED
linking:
"waiting a" → /ˈweɪtɪŋ ə/ (g links to article)
"finish the" → /ˈfɪnɪʃ ðə/ (sh links to th)

speaker: Lena
text: No worries. Maya, how’s the frontend integration?
ipa: noʊ ˈwɝriz | ˈmaɪə | haʊz ðə ˈfrʌntˌɛnd ˌɪntəˈɡreɪʃən
stress: NO WORRIES | MAYA | HOW’S THE FRONTEND INTEGRATION
linking:
"how’s the" → /haʊz ðə/ (z links to article)
"frontend integration" → /ˈfrʌntˌɛnd ˌɪntəˈɡreɪʃən/ (d links to vowel)

speaker: Maya
text: It’s coming together. The new design is cleaner, and the layout feels more intuitive. I added some transitions to make it visually smoother.
ipa: ɪts ˈkʌmɪŋ təˈɡɛðɚ | ðə nu dɪˈzaɪn ɪz ˈkliːnɚ | ənd ðə ˈleɪˌaʊt fiːlz mɔr ɪnˈtuːɪtɪv | aɪ ˈædɪd səm trænˈzɪʃənz tə meɪk ɪt ˈvɪʒuəli ˈsmuːðɚ
stress: IT’S COMING TOGETHER | THE NEW DESIGN IS CLEANER | AND THE LAYOUT FEELS MORE INTUITIVE | I ADDED SOME TRANSITIONS TO MAKE IT VISUALLY SMOOTHER
linking:
"coming together" → /ˈkʌmɪŋ təˈɡɛðɚ/ (g links into t)
"make it" → /meɪk ɪt/ (k links to i)

speaker: Lena
text: Awesome. Does it work well on mobile?
ipa: ˈɔsəm | dʌz ɪt wɝk wɛl ɑn ˈmoʊbəl
stress: AWESOME | DOES IT WORK WELL ON MOBILE
linking:
"does it" → /dʌz ɪt/ (z links to i)
"well on" → /wɛl ɑn/ (l links to o)

speaker: Maya
text: Yes! Actually, it runs even better on phones than before. I simplified the components and used lighter assets.
ipa: jɛs | ˈækʧuəli | ɪt rʌnz ˈivən ˈbɛɾɚ ɑn foʊnz ðən bɪˈfɔr | aɪ ˈsɪmplɪˌfaɪd ðə kəmˈpoʊnənts ənd juːzd ˈlaɪtɚ ˈæsɛts
stress: YES | ACTUALLY | IT RUNS EVEN BETTER ON PHONES THAN BEFORE | I SIMPLIFIED THE COMPONENTS AND USED LIGHTER ASSETS
linking:
"runs even" → /rʌnz ˈivən/ (z links into e)
"used lighter" → /juːzd ˈlaɪtɚ/ (d links to l)

speaker: Lena
text: That’s great to hear. Out of curiosity, whose module loaded fastest during your last test?
ipa: ðæts ɡreɪt tə hɪr | aʊt əv ˌkjʊriˈɑsəti | huz ˈmɑʤul ˈloʊdɪd ˈfæstəst ˈdʊrɪŋ jʊr læst tɛst
stress: THAT’S GREAT TO HEAR | OUT OF CURIOSITY | WHOSE MODULE LOADED FASTEST DURING YOUR LAST TEST
linking:
"out of" → /aʊt əv/ (t links to v)
"loaded fastest" → /ˈloʊdɪd ˈfæstəst/ (d links to f)

speaker: Maya
text: Surprisingly, Tim’s API was the quickest, even with partial data. Mine came in second fastest.
ipa: sɚˈpraɪzɪŋli | tɪmz ˌeɪpiˈaɪ wəz ðə ˈkwɪkəst | ˈivən wɪθ ˈpɑrʃəl ˈdeɪtə | maɪn keɪm ɪn ˈsɛkənd ˈfæstəst
stress: SURPRISINGLY | TIM’S API WAS THE QUICKEST | EVEN WITH PARTIAL DATA | MINE CAME IN SECOND FASTEST
linking:
"was the" → /wəz ðə/ (z links to article)
"came in" → /keɪm ɪn/ (m links into i)

speaker: Lena
text: Haha, well done! Let’s aim to wrap up testing by the end of the week, so we can start polishing. Sound good?
ipa: hɑːhɑː | wɛl dʌn | lɛts eɪm tə ræp ʌp ˈtɛstɪŋ baɪ ði ɛnd əv ðə wiːk | soʊ wi kən stɑrt ˈpɑlɪʃɪŋ | saʊnd ɡʊd
stress: HAHA | WELL DONE | LET’S AIM TO WRAP UP TESTING BY THE END OF THE WEEK | SO WE CAN START POLISHING | SOUND GOOD
linking:
"wrap up" → /ræp ʌp/ (p links into u)
"end of" → /ɛnd əv/ (d links to v)
